name: Brandon Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like the title says....it was a good nights sleep and the location is fine away from the downtown area but within walking distance. The beds were ok, and the room good. Lobby is really nice but the room was in the older part of the hotel. The breakfast included was a nice buffet, one of the better ones I got on my week in Ireland, but oddly, we watched the waitress ask every table if they wanted eggs....but us! After 15 minutes I finally asked if we got eggs with our meal and she said "yes what do you want?". Hmmmm...bizarre.
reviews.title: Nice place - Clean, Comfortable but pricey

reviews.text: The place was pricey, but as we could not locate the main street in the downtown area after dark even with our GPS we stopped at the Brandon hotel since it was in a less busy section of town and had free parking in the back and figured the place was probably less expensive as well. Damn...we were wrong....upon checking kayak online...whoa this was the most expensive place.....could have stayed at the fancy place downtown for much less and saved ourselves the walk.
reviews.title: Bit dated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here over bank holiday weekend at short notice. I was given a room in the old part - they still use old fashioned room keys! The decor was also old fashioned - worn pattered carpet on the stairs and corridors, dark stained furniture and doors making the place dark and depressing. The room was a decent size but the bed linen on both beds consisted of stained blankets that didn't match. During both nights it was cold in the room (I could not turn on the heater) and there were no spare blankets.On the plus side the bar was modern with comfortable squashy leather couches and the residents lounge was large and very quiet, at least during the day.The hotel is centrally located. good for checking out the shops in town, Siamsa Tire theatre or the Aquadome are all very close by. If they renovate the old part of the hotel it's well worth it
reviews.title: Tired!

reviews.text: This hotel has seen better days. Reception area is deceptive, as it is a wonderful front to a shabby exterior. Bar tables all sticky, bedrooms lacklustre and considering it was the most expensive place we stayed in the whole of Ireland, it was the worst. Would not recommend this place. Pity.
reviews.title: Do not stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here with my parents on the 28th September.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in the heart of the town

description: Whatever the occasion, the Brandon Hotel Conference & Leisure Centre Tralee offers you a warm and friendly welcome in the heart of Tralee. Only minutes walk from Tralee town centre, it is the perfect location to relax after doing a spot of shopping, taking in the sights of Kerry or sampling the nightlife in Tralee. The Brandon Hotel encapsulates timeless elegance with comfort,and the names has long since been synonymous with quality since it opened in 1966. Guests enjoy an outstanding service, a charming and friendly atmosphere and traditionally furnished surroundings, not to mention state-of-the-art leisure facilities and a purpose-built conference centre.
